arm_group.description: Intensive Lifestyle Intervention at Ubberup Folk High School for 10-14 weeks. Daily exercise for 1-3hrs. Calorie restriction (~-700KCal/day). Education within nutrition, exercise and healthy living in general.

brief_summary.textblock:
In Denmark and the western world, there is an increasing prevalence of obesity probably due
      to a combination of inadequate daily physical activity and a high energy intake. One
      approach to achieve weight loss and change life style is to participate in an intensive
      supervised prolonged life style modification course. The immediate effect is often positive,
      but over time the overall effect is limited as the majority will not maintain weight loss
      and a changed life style.

      The purpose of this study is therefore to characterize the physiological factors that
      determine/influence the capacity to maintain weight loss and a healthy lifestyle after a
      prolonged lifestyle intervention.

      We have the following research questions:

        1. Are there physiological traits and characteristics that mediate better adherence to
           lifestyle changes and weight loss?

        2. Does the adaptation in muscle oxidative capacity after lifestyle intervention predict
           success in maintaining weight loss and lifestyle changes 3, 12 and 39 months after
           intervention?

        3. How does gender and age influence the capacity to maintain the lifestyle induced
           adaptation in muscle and adipose tissue and maintaining weight loss?

      The study design is a longitudinal intervention and will be based on a lifestyle
      intervention, as it is practiced in a real life setting at Ubberup folk high school.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physiological Factors That Influence Maintenance of Lifestyle Changes and Weight Loss - a Longitudinal Study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Participants at Ubberup Folk High School

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous Gastric Bypass Surgery or Gastric Banding

          -  BMI<25

facility.name: University of Copenhagen, Department of Biomedical Sciences

clinical_study.official_title: Physiological Factors That Influence Maintenance of Lifestyle Changes and Weight Loss - a Longitudinal Study

other_outcome.description: International Physical Activity Questionaire (IPAQ) to determine adherence to physical activity. Furthermore we will use diary and ActiHeart (accelerometer).
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.description: Questionnaire (24hrs dietary recall) and diary to determine adherence to a healthy diet.
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.description: Mitochondria respiration and efficiency is measured by Oreboros Oxygraph.
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.description: HbA1c, insulin, leptin, glucose, adiponectin, thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH), ghrelin
other_outcome.measure: Blood and plasma substrates, hormones and metabolites
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.description: Muscle lipid composition will be analysed using a lipidomics approach.
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.description: Western blot analysis will be applied to analyse expression of muscle lipases; hormone sensitive lipase (HSL), adipose triglyceride lipase (ATGL) and lipoprotein lipase (LPL) as well as muscle PAT proteins; PLIN 2 (ADRP), PLIN 3 (TIP47) and PLIN 5 (OXPAT)
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.description: Intramuscular lipid droplet content and size, glycogen content and ceramide content and location will be quantified by immunohistochemical staining of serial cryo-sections of muscle tissue samples that are visualized by confocal microscopy
other_outcome.measure: Intramuscular lipid droplet content and size, glycogen content and ceramide content and location
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.measure: Adipose tissue macrophage inflammation and cytokine production
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

other_outcome.measure: Motivation for lifestyle changes and sociological factors involved
other_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months

overall_official.affiliation: University of Copenhagen, Department of Biomedical Sciences

primary_outcome.time_frame: Changes from baseline at 3, 6, 15 and 39 months
